channel.title: EXP Fail?
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i553.photobucket.com/albums/jj374/AD_Setsuna/assassinfaild.jpg[/img]
Trying to get the exp to update in the music tab here...As you can see....It's still at 0. I know the goes up and works and all that after some other testing...But it just will not update in the music tab. Any help?

item.title: EXP Fail?
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Did that.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 26, 2009, 09:14:26 pm[/size][hr] if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 4) { int Player = npcs[NPCID].StartKilling; client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player]; if (ppl.assassinTask == 1) { ppl.women += 1; ppl.assassinExp += 2; ppl.savemoreinfo(); } }

Got that in my npchandler…

EDIT: Does not appear to be saving…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 27, 2009, 02:36:40 pm[/size][hr]-sigh- Love how 90% of people on here post once and leave thinking they’ve solved the problem…

Read full topic

item.title: EXP Fail?
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Update it when you’re in combat with the npc or after the npc has been killed.

Read full topic

item.title: EXP Fail?
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

sendQuest("@whi@Assassin Exp: " +assassinExp, 3206); sendQuest("@whi@Assassin Level: " +assassinLvl, 5449);

What I have in there atm…And when I log in and out it still does not update.

Read full topic

item.title: EXP Fail?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Use Process! JK, but yeah thats the only way really…

Edit: It’s like that because it is only being written to the Interface once, and not again after more xp has been added.

Read full topic
